title: Bond Yields Near Three-Year Highs, Weighing on Stock Futures
sub_head: The gap between the yields on two-year and 10-year Treasury notes narrowed. Investors typically view inversion as a recession predictor.
body:
U.S. stock futures wavered and bond yields rose near their highest level in three years as investors prepared for a campaign of interest-rate increases from the Federal Reserve.
Futures for the S&P 500 edged down 0.1% Monday. Last week, U.S. stocks rebounded for a second consecutive week. Contracts for the tech-focused Nasdaq-100 receded 0.3% and futures for the Dow Jones Industrial Average added 0.1% Monday.
